page.title: 10Church and Chapel,Lenches
page.content: The only church in this area is All Saints. A church on this site was mentioned in the original Domesday Book. It was replaced by a Norman church. The fourteenth century tower with pinnacles is included in the national list of "buildings of architectural interest". One of the original bells, No.5,still calls the congregation to worship. It has the inscription "GEVEF THANKS TO GOD" and is also inscribed wih the names of the churchwardens in 1600. The churchyard is very welcoming and local people have generously given their time and skill to preserve the fabric of the building and surrounds. The average Sunday morning congregation is 45. There is a full range of study groups for all ages. Atch Lench has a Baptist Church built in 1820.
